page.title: 02Landscape, Faceby
page.content: {A scenic area}with panoramic views from Carlton Bank over a patchwork of grass and arable fields, westward to the distant Pennines, northward to the heights of Durham, and backed on south and east by moorland broken up by river valleys. There are no stone walls; hedges divide the fields. In the centre lies the village of{Faceby. {Whorl Hill}and the lower slopes of the escarpment are covered by managed plantations, mixed and coniferous. There are smaller wooded areas, and some fine trees in parkland at Faceby Manor.{Carlton Bank,}scene of former alum and sandstone quarry workings, is scarred by motor cyclists and over-use of three long-distance walks which cross the area. Conspicuous along the hillside and on pasture land on Whorl Hill are the spoil heaps of burnt jet shale, reddish brown in colour.
